sense.name: transmission channel
sense.commentary: a path over which electrical signals can pass
sense.examples: A channel is typically what you rent from a telephone company.

sense.name: groove
sense.commentary: a long narrow shallow furrow cut either by a natural process (such as erosion) or by a tool (e.g. a groove in a phonograph record or an irrigation channels)
sense.examples: The fields were crossed with irrigation channels.

sense.name: narrow passage for vessels
sense.commentary: A deep and relatively narrow body of water (as in a river or a harbor or a strait linking two larger bodies) that allows the best passage for vessels
sense.examples: The ship went aground in the channel.

sense.name: means of communication
sense.commentary: communication channel, line - (often plural) a means of communication or access
sense.examples: It must go through official channels. Lines of communication were set up between the two firms.

sense.name: bodily canal
sense.commentary: duct, epithelial duct, canal - a bodily passage or tube lined with epithelial cells and conveying a secretion or other substance
sense.examples: Poison is released through a channel in the snake's fangs.

sense.name: tv station
sense.commentary: TV channel, television channel - a television station and it's programs
sense.examples: A satellite TV channel. Surfing through the channels. They offer more than one hundred channels. I get thirty channels, though many of them show the same programs.

sense.name: seller
sense.commentary: a way of selling a company's product either directly or via distributors
sense.examples: There are many possible distribution channels. Wholesalers, small retailers, retail chains, or direct mailers are all possible distribution channels. Door-to-door salespeople are his preferred distribution channel.
